newsitem.title: SPAIN: Clinton hails NATO expansion as "giant stride".
newsitem.headline: Clinton hails NATO expansion as "giant stride".

text.p: U.S. President Bill Clinton on Tuesday praised NATO's invitation to Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic to join the alliance, saying it marked a "giant stride" towards a new Europe that is undivided, democratic and at peace.

"The statement we released today and the decision we made was a genuine consensus effort and I am profoundly grateful to all of my fellow world leaders who are part of NATO," Clinton said after the Western alliance had agreed to the largest expansion in its 48-year history.
In issuing the invitation to the three former communist Warsaw Pact states, NATO leaders named Slovenia and Romania as prime candidates for the next round of expansion.

Their declaration also cited the Baltic states as "aspiring members" -- a move that could irritate Russia, which has said it would consider NATO membership by former Soviet republics a threat to its own security.

"We have taken a giant stride in our efforts to create a Europe that is undivided, democratic and at peace literally for the first time since the rise of the nation state on the European continent," Clinton said.

Clinton had insisted on limiting the first round of NATO expansion to Poland, Hungary and the Czech Republic, rejecting a French-led clamour to include Romania and Slovenia as well. But he told U.S. embassy employees after the historic decision was made: "This is not an American achievement, this is a NATO achievement".
